title.narrative: Stöd till reform av valssystem och processer
Support to reform of election systems and processes

description.narrative:
There are two main goals of the intervention.
First goal: To put in place institutional, electoral and political reforms through efficient coordination of the concerned UN bodies.
Second goal: To organize a constitutional referendum and general elections (presidential, legislative, regional, communal and local) as stipulated in the transitional agreement.

UNDP-Mali har den maliska övergångsregeringens formella uppdrag att stödja övergången till ett demokratiskt styrelseskick, att bidra till reformer vad gäller valprocesser och stödja organisering av allmänna val.
UNDP-Mali, i samarbete med MINUSMA och UN-Women har inkommit med en ansökan om stöd till dessa två processer med en total budget om ca 55 miljoner USD mellan 1 juli 2021-31 december 2023. Omkring 46 procent av insatsen är finansierad av bland annat Kanada, EU, Norge, Spanien utöver Sverige. UNDP-Mali för diskussioner med andra länder som är intresserade att bidra.
UNDP-Mali är en nyckelaktör vad gäller valprocesser i Mali och har varit delaktig i dessa sedan Mali övergick till demokratiska val 1992. På FN:s Generalsekreterares uppdrag genomfördes en så kallad Needs Assessment Mission (NAM) vad gäller FN:s möjligheter att stödja kommande val i Mali. Rapporten rekommenderade ett nytt projekt under UNDP-Malis ledning för att stödja reformprocesser och organiserandet av allmänna val. Vidare rekommenderades upprättandet av en så kallad "basket fund" i syfte att underlätta UNDP:s koordinerande roll av det internationella samfundets bidrag samt att säkerställa att stödet blir sammanhållet och relevant. Insatsen omfattar även aktiviteter som ska genomföras av International IDEA (max fem miljoner SEK) som inom ramen för UNDP-Malis uppdrag ska stödja reformarbetet vad gäller konstitution och valprocesser.
Förändringsteorin som ligger till grund för UNDP:s valprogram är följande: Om de politiska förväntningar vad gäller politisk och institutionell reform infrias och om det maliska samhället deltar i ökad omfattning i valen och får ökat förtroende för de valförättande institutionerna och om de politiska aktörerna kan lösa sina politiska konflikter så kommer Mali träda in i en fas med demokratisk samhällsstyrning.
UNDP har två resultatområden. Det ena handlar om teknisk, logistisk och finansiellt stöd till övergångsregeringen att förbereda för val. Förväntade resultat är konstitutionell översyn och skapandet av nya val distrikt.
Det andra resultatområdet är praktiskt stöd till organiseringen och genomförande av val. Förväntade resultat av dessa aktiviteter är bland annat färdigställande av vallistor, utbildning av valarbetare, planering av val, stöd till inkludering av kvinnor i valen, uppsökande av väljare och förebyggande av konflikter relaterade till val.

UNDP-Mali has the Malian transitional government's formal request to support the transition to a democratic governance, to contribute to electoral reform and support the organisation of general elections.
In collaboration with MINUSMA and UN Women, UNDP-Mali has applied for funding to support these two processes with a total budget of 55 million USD to be carried out between July 1, 2021 to December 31, 2023. Around 46 percent of the intervention is financed by Canada, EU, Norway, Spain in addition to Sweden. UNDP-Mali is in discussion with other countries that are interested in contributing.
UNDP-Mali is a key actor with regards to elections in Mali and has been involved in organizing elections since Mali transitioned to democratic elections in 1992. At the request of the Secretary General of the UN, a Needs Assessment Mission (NAM) has been carried Spring 2021 regarding the possibilities of UN to support elections in Mali. The final report recommended a renewed support to UNDP-Mali to support electoral reform processes and the organizing of elections. In addition, the report recommends the set-up of a basket fund mechanism so to facilitate the coordinating role of UNDP-Mali, in addition to ensure the coherency and relevance of the support of the international community. The contribution includes a niched support to International IDEA (five million SEK) in the domain of constitutional and electoral reform.
The theory of change that underlies the proposed program is as follows: If the political expectations on political and institutional reform are met and if the Malian society trust the electoral institutions to an increasing extent and participates in the elections and if the political actors can solve their political conflicts then Mali will evolve in a phase of democratic governance.
UNDP-Mali has two result areas. The first is technical, logistical and financial support to the transitional government to prepare for elections. The expected results are constitutional oversight and the creation of new election districts.
The other result area is practical support to the organisation and implementation of elections. The expected results of these activities are among others: the completion of electoral lists, training of election workers, planning of elections, support to the inclusion of women in the elections, voter outreach and election related conflict prevention and mitigation.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution to support to reform of election systems and processes

description.narrative:
Despite that the transitional authorities has not announced an election calender and the current dead-lock in negotiations between the authorities and ECOWAS, UNDP-Mali has started working on several preparatory processes as envisaged by the workplan.
Out of 43 activities planned to start 2021, UNDP has began working on 11 activities in 2021.
Some of these activities for each result area are mentioned below.
First Axe: support to the reform process in the pre-electoral phase: (Activities 1.1.2 & 3, 1.2.1 & 2 in the workplan) - Operationalisation of electorial districts in the newly formed regions. - Census and preparation of electoral lists in the newly formed regions. - Organising electoral deliberations on the expectancies of constitutional & electoral reform in all the regions. - Awareness-raising & support to civil society and media with regards of constitutional and electoral reform and the organisation of administrative units within the country.
Second Axe: support to the organisation of the before mentioned elections (activities 2.1.1 & 2, 2.2.1 & 2) - Training of election staff - Acquisition and installation of technical equipment - Support to planing and co-ordination of electoral cycle - Awareness-raising for the inclusion of women and youth in the elections.
Third Axe: the post-transitional phase in support of democratic governance of the institutions - Not relevant
Embassy assessment: The UNDP-election program has started to prepare itself for elections. The Embassy notes that that the cooperation between UNDP, MINUSMA and UN-Women seem to be working. This is an important factor for the successful handling of elections. However, without an election calender, there is only a limited scope of activities for UNDP-Mali to do. In view of this, in case the dead-lock continues, the Embassy will have to consider if there are alternative ways of how to use its resources.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
